channel.title: Travel
channel.description: Travel news, tips and photography from destinations all over the globe. Regular features include 36 Hours, The Frugal Traveler and Stephanie Rosenbloom's column, The Getaway.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2016 The New York Times Company

item.title: How to Have a Culturally Rich Vacation
item.description: For a more fulfilling getaway, avoid set tours, hire a local guide and stay at small, locally owned hotels.
item.author: By SHIVANI VORA

item.title: Dreading a President Clinton or Trump? How to Try a New Country
item.description: If the election is making you consider leaving the United States, expats have a few words of advice on how to travel as if you’re moving rather than going on vacation.
item.author: By JULIE LASKY

item.title: A Very Jonathan Adler Hotel
item.description: His banana sculpture is ready for its close-up at the Parker Palm Springs.
item.author: By JOHN WOGAN

item.title: A Georgia Hotel Takes Its Cues From a Quiet Beach and Dunes
item.description: The 200-room Starwood hotel opened last year as part of a major revitalization of Jekyll Island, Georgia’s historic barrier island.
item.author: By ADAM H. GRAHAM

item.title: A Venice Restaurant With Its Ethos Right in Its Name
item.description: Everything that Local serves originates nearby, or at least has a Venetian twist, including the chef.
item.author: By MELENA RYZIK

item.title: Billboard, Souvenir, Metaphor: The Many Uses of a German Beer Coaster
item.description: Anywhere that kegs are tapped in Germany, you’ll find the pressed-paper discs known as bierdeckel — and people who creatively repurpose them.
item.author: By MELISSA EDDY

item.title: New York Area Has the Nation’s 3 Worst Airports, Study Says
item.description: A travel website’s examination of timeliness, accessibility and amenities at the United States’ 30 busiest airports found fault with La Guardia, J.F.K. and Newark.
item.author: By DANIEL VICTOR

item.title: The History of Southern Africa, by Train
item.description: It’s the best way to make sense of the continent’s epic scope, wild splendor and bloody colonial history.
item.author: By TED CONOVER

item.title: 36 Hours in Manhattan, Below 59th Street
item.description: The center of the world — filled with restaurants and glamorous nightclubs — lies between Central Park and the Battery.
item.author: By SETH KUGEL

item.title: Exploring the Speakeasies of Rome
item.description: Hidden from sight in the Eternal City, high cocktail culture is flourishing in a host of secret bars.
item.author: By LAURA RYSMAN
